titleStmt.title: A. Kahn to James F. Robinson
CWG8866

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Frankfort Ky June 1863
To
His Excellency J. F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner would most respectfully represent to your Excellency that at the June term 1862 one August Rosenbaum was fined in the Franklin Circuit Court the sum of Sixty ($60.) Dollars, upon the charge of keeping a tipling house The judgment was replevied and upon representations then made your petitioner was induced to become security theron He would further represent that within a few days Rosenbaum has left this country for Europe and that the bond will expire on the 4th day of June 1863, that as the case now stands your petitioner will have the amount to pay which he can illy afford to do. He would further represent that had he have known that it was Rosenbaums intention to have left the country he would not have give upon his bond, Under the circumstances and owing to the times and difficulty of getting money Your petitioner would most urgently and respectfully
solicit the remission of the Judgment
We the undersigned most cheerfully unite in Mr Kahn's petition and would beg leave to state that we know him as a good citizen and a man of truth.

M B Holeman
W F Parrent
Q. W. Pruett
John Haly
Geo. B. Macklin
W. H. Sneed
Sanford Goins
Louis Wetzel
John R Graham
G. W, Owen
R. G. Slack
H. B. James
D. G. Venable
A W Vattem Bingham
John, W

Franklin Cir. Ct
$60 } Tipling
A. Kahn
The fine this case is all remitted except the sum of twenty dollars & all costs
This remission only on behalf of A Kahn the surety
